Authors: Panatra A.J., Chandra F.B., Darmawan W., Warnars H.L.H.S., Utomo W.H., Matsuo T.
Title: Buzzer Detection to Maintain Information Neutrality in 2019 Indonesia Presidential Election
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 8th International Congress on Advanced Applied Informatics, IIAI-AAI 2019
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program Doctor of Computer Science Bina, Nusantara University Jakarta11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Computing President University, Jawa Barat, 17550, Indonesia; Graduate School of Industrial Technology Advanced, Institute of Industrial Technology, Tokyo, Japan
Authors with affiliations: Panatra, A.J., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Chandra, F.B., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Darmawan, W., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Warnars, H.L.H.S., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program Doctor of Computer Science Bina, Nusantara University Jakarta11480, Indonesia; Utomo, W.H., Faculty of Computing President University, Jawa Barat, 17550, Indonesia; Matsuo, T., Graduate School of Industrial Technology Advanced, Institute of Industrial Technology, Tokyo, Japan
Abstract: This paper proposed a method which detects a political buzzer in social media, specifically Instagram. With Indonesia undergoing 2019 presidential election, a detection of buzzers that causes much trouble in maintaining information neutrality is seen as a needed. One of the many reasons is because those buzzers spread false news making the information gained by the use of social media to be not neutral and deliberately offends or attack those that they are not in favor of. Those buzzers share a similar characteristic, tendency, or even possess the same pattern. Grouping, classification, and detection method are used to counter this problem. This research gives a slight overview of what is happening in social media and a theory of how to deal with those problems. The argument is expected to help to identify buzzer in real life, thus helps in maintaining information neutrality along with the social media in Indonesia. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: 2019 Indonesia Presidential Election; buzzer detection; social media retrieval
Index Keywords: Detection methods; Indonesia; Presidential election; Social media; Social networking (online)
